This test checks that a device policy is properly saved and loaded across reboots.\n\nPress the \"Generate Policy\" button to create a random policy. Then press the \"Apply Policy\" button to apply the policy. Reboot the device and verify that all rows in the policy list are green. Red items indicate policy settings that were not loaded properly.

This test checks that an active device administrator can be easily uninstalled from the application details screen in a way similar to other apps. This test requires CtsEmptyDeviceAdmin.apk to be installed on the device.
This test checks that an activity cannot tapjack the user by obscuring the device admin details while prompting the user to activate the admin.

This test ensures that car mode opens the app associated with car dock when going into car mode.

 Click on "Enable Car Mode" to start the test. Clicking on the button will either bring up a disambiguation dialog asking which app to open or immediately open the CAR_DOCK application. Select the "CTS Verifier" app and then "Always" if the dialog pops up. This will open the CAR_DOCK application.

 In the CAR_DOCK application, press the home button, which will enable the pass button if the framework correctly tries to open the CAR_DOCK app again.

1. Press the "Generate Policy" to create a random device policy

2. Press "Apply Policy" to put the policy into effect.

3. Reboot your device and return to this test in the CTS Verifier.
Reboot your device and return to this CTS Verifier test.

This test checks that the DevicePolicyManager\'s lockNow method immediately locks the screen. It should lock the screen immediately despite any settings that may specify a timeout.\n\nClick the \"Force Lock\" button to lock the screen. Your screen should be locked and require the password to be entered.
Redacted Notifications Keyguard Disabled Features Test
It appears the screen was locked successfully!
It does not look like the screen was locked...
Please install the \'Test Device Admin\' app (packaged as CtsEmptyDeviceAdmin.apk) on the device.
\'Test Device Admin\' installed on the device.
Add \'Test Device Admin\' as an active administrator on the device. Tap the button below to review the device admin details and activate the administrator.

Attempt to uninstall the app from the application details page of the \'Test Device Admin\' app. You should see another screen showing the device admin details before you can uninstall the app from the device. Wait till the app is uninstalled before returning to this page.
This activity attempts to tapjack the activity below.\n Any security sensitive controls below should not respond to taps as long as this activity is visible.

1. Launch the device admin add screen by pressing the button below.
 2. Wait for an overlaying transparent activity to show up obscuring the device admin details window.
 3. The button to activate the admin should be disabled and should not register any taps.
 4. Press 'back' to exit the overlaying transparent activity.
 5. Press 'back' to exit the device admin details and return to this screen.
 Pass the test if the device admin could not be activated while the details window was being obscured.

This test ensures that Keystore cryptographic keys that are bound to lock screen authentication are unusable without a recent enough authentication. You need to set up a screen lock in order to complete this test. If available, this test should be run by using fingerprint authentication as well as PIN/pattern/password authentication.
This test ensures that Keystore cryptographic keys that are bound to fingerprint authentication are unusable without an authentication. You need to set up a fingerprint order to complete this test.

The Bluetooth Control tests check whether or not the device can disable and enable Bluetooth properly. 

The Bluetooth tests require two devices, and Bluetooth data is exchanged between them. 
There are two types of connections: Insecure and Secure. There are two types of roles: Server and Client. You must pass all connection and role combinations. 
This is a list of the tests: 
This Device x Other Device 

"Bluetooth LE Insecure Client Test" x "Bluetooth LE Insecure Server Test" 

"Bluetooth LE Insecure Server Test" x "Bluetooth LE Insecure Client Test" 

"Bluetooth LE Secure Client Test" x "Bluetooth LE Secure Server Test" 

"Bluetooth LE Secure Server Test" x "Bluetooth LE Secure Client Test" 

The Device Communication tests require two devices to pair and exchange messages. The two devices must be: 

1. a candidate device implementation running the software build to be tested 

2. a separate device implementation already known to be compatible
Disable and enable Bluetooth to successfully complete this test.

Start the CTS Verifier on another device, start the Bluetooth test, and choose "Connection Access Client" to setup the test. 

First, unpair the devices via Bluetooth settings. Then connect the devices together using the "Make Discoverable" and "Pick Server" buttons. 

A connection access request should appear on the server and enable the pass button.

Start the CTS Verifier on another device, start the Bluetooth test, and choose \"Connection Access Server\" to complete the test. \n\nMake the device acting as the server discoverable and connect to it via the \"Pick Server\" button. Check that the server displays the connection access request dialog. The client device does not need to do anything else.
Was the connection access request dialog shown?

Tap the \"Bluetooth Settings\" button and check that both devices are not paired before running the test. \n\nUse the \"Make Discoverable\" and \"Pick Server\" buttons to connect the two Bluetooth devices together and start the test.
Start the CTS Verifier on another device, start the Bluetooth test, and choose \"Secure Client\" to complete the test.
Start the CTS Verifier on another device, start the Bluetooth test, and choose \"Insecure Client\" to complete the test.
Insecure connections should not show the pairing dialog!
Advertising is not supported on this device.\nTest finishes.
Device must be unpaired via Bluetooth settings before completing the test.\n\nUnpair the device in settings, make the server discoverable, and rescan to pick this device.
Bluetooth LE GATT Client Handler Service
Bluetooth LE Reliable Write (receive bad response)
The Bluetooth LE test must be done simultaneously on two devices. This device is the client. All tests listed here must be done with out pairing.
Type in the Bluetooth address of the remote device to connect to, and verify that the devices are connected.
Verify that the service is discovered when you press the "Discover Service" button.
Write values to and read values from the server to verify that the write and read functionalities are working correctly.

A Reliable Write has two steps.

1) Write to the device. This will trigger a callback from the server to verify that the value written was correct.
2) Execute the write, if the value written is valid.
Start accepting notifications, and verify that notifications are being reported correctly. The server should be notifying this device with the time every second.
Press button to read the RSSI value. Verify that the RSSI changes as you move the two devices further apart or closer together.
Verify that the device is disconnected when you press the "Disconnect" button
This test requires a few minutes. Don\'t interrupt the test.
Bluetooth LE GATT Server Handler Service
The Bluetooth LE test must be done simultaneously on two devices, a server device and a client device. This device is the server.
Waiting on connection from Bluetooth LE client.
Adding service to Bluetooth LE server.
Waiting on reliable write from client
Waiting on reliable write from client (send bad response)
Waiting on disconnection from Bluetooth LE client
02 Bluetooth LE Connection Priority Server Test
Bluetooth LE Connection Priority Server receive message from message in 3 different priority.
Waiting on write characteristic request without permission
Waiting on read characteristic request without permission
Waiting on write descriptor request without permission
Waiting on read descriptor request without permission
Waiting on write encrypted characteristic request
Waiting on write encrypted descriptor request
Waiting on read encrypted descriptor request
Bluetooth LE Encrypted Server Waiting on read/write characteristic and descriptor request need encrypted.

Bluetooth LE Server is in operation.
This test does not change server state.

If Bluetooth pairing request was notified by system, you must cancel it.

Once the client tests are all successful, please change the state of the server-side to the "success".

This test is mostly automated, but requires some user interaction. Once the list items below have check marks, the test is complete. 

Tap "01 Bluetooth LE Server Test" on this device, then tap "01 Bluetooth LE Client Test" on the other device. 
When the test is complete, move to the next item. You must complete all tests.

This test is mostly automated, but requires some user interaction. You can pass this test once the list items below are checked. 

Tap "01 Bluetooth LE Server Test" on this device, then tap "01 Bluetooth LE Client Test "on other device. 
Test completed, then test next item. You must be done all tests.

The Bluetooth LE Advertiser Test and Scanner Test is a paired test. \nTap \"Bluetooth LE Advertiser Test\" on this device. Once it is passed, tap \"Bluetooth LE Scanner Test\". \nTap \"Bluetooth LE Scanner Test\" on this device. Once it is passed, tap \"Bluetooth LE Advertiser Test\".
Bluetooth LE Advertiser should advertise in non-repeating MAC address.

Click start to start advertising, you can disconnect USB and lock the screen of advertiser. Counts and mac address will show on scanner. You may receive message that this device does not support Bluetooth LE advertising.
Bluetooth LE Advertiser advertises in 4 different power levels. Scanner should receive them in different strength of Rssi, cannot receive weak signals beyond several feet.

Click start to start multi-advertising. Data packets are advertised in 4 different power levels. You may receive a message that this device does not support multi-advertising. If the advertiser does not advertise in 4 power levels, and you do not receive an error message, you may not have stopped advertising in the previous test, or this device may not support 4 advertisers at the same time. Try rebooting the device and running the test again to free those advertisers in use.
Bluetooth LE Advertiser advertises with 2 different data separately. One can wake up the scanner, the other cannot. This test cares about behavior on scanner only.
Start scannable advertising, expect scanner consume more power on Monsoon monitor, or see log of GattService from scanner logcat.
Start unscannable advertising, expect scanner stay calm on Monsoon monitor, no log of GattService from scanner logcat.
The Bluetooth LE test must be done simultaneously on two devices, an advertiser and a scanner. This device is the scanner.
Hold for 15 min to see if receive a different MAC address from advertiser.
Mac address, counts are shown on screen. It should continuously receive data packet from advertiser. Every 15 min, a new mac address should show up, which prevents mac address disclosure.

Count: Ultra low < low < medium < high
Rssi: Ultra low < low < medium < high
Distance to see count freezing: Ultra low < low < medium < high
A common error is ultra low, low and medium behave similarly, with similar rssi, freeze at similar distance.

 All power level receive a mac address.
Lock the screen of scanner, and connect to monsoon. It will not wake up when advertiser is advertising unscannable, and scanner is scanning with filter.

Scan filter is to scan data with service UUID = 0x6666 only. If you scan without scan filter, data with service UUID = 0x5555 and 0x6666 will show up on screen.
For monsoon test:
	Click scan with filter, lock the screen, connect to monsoon. It will not wake up when advertiser is advertising unscannable data packets, but will show a peak in power usage when advertiser is advertising scannable data.
For logcat test:
	Click scan with filter, logcat the scanner. No data will be received by GattService when advertiser is advertising unscannable data.

Transfer interval time (msec):
HIGH=%1$d
BALANCED=%2$d
LOW=%3$d

Requirements:
 HIGH <= BALANCED <= LOW
Bluetooth LE Read Characteristic Without Perrmission
Bluetooth LE Write Characteristic Without Permission
Bluetooth LE Read Descriptor Without Perrmission
Bluetooth LE Write Descriptor Without Permission
02 Bluetooth LE Connection Priority Client Test
Bluetooth LE Connection Priority Client send message in 3 different priority.
Bluetooth LE Encrypted Client read/write on characteristic and descriptor need encrypted.

The Bluetooth LE test must be done simultaneously on two devices. This device is the client. All tests listed here must be done without pairing. Tap "Bluetooth LE Insecure Server Test" on the other device. 

Tap "01 Bluetooth LE Client Test" on this device, then tap "01 Bluetooth LE Server Test" on the other device. 
When the test is complete, move to the next item. You must complete all tests.

The Bluetooth LE test must be done simultaneously on two devices. This device is the client. All tests listed here must be done with pairing. 

Tap "01 Bluetooth LE Client Test" on this device, then tap "01 Bluetooth LE Server Test" on the other device. 
When the test is complete, move to the next item. You must complete all tests.
It failed to write to Characteristic.
It failed to write to Descriptor.
It failed to read the Characteristic.
It failed to read the Descriptor.
The Bluetooth LE test must be done simultaneously on two devices. This device is the client. All tests listed here must be done with pairing.
Bluetooth pairing state is a mismatch!
And even though it has already been trying to run a test of Secure, the device has not been paired. \nGo setting mode, set Bluetooth to pair other device.
And even though it has already been trying to run a test of Insecure, the device has already been paired. \nGo setting mode, set Bluetooth to unpair other device.
MTU test: failed to receive data

This test checks that APIs to manage companion devices are working correctly, including showing the dialog to the user to verify a device, as well as updating an internal record once the user made the choice and then removing it.\n\n Before proceeding, make sure you have a bluetooth device nearby and discoverable. Also, make sure that bluetooth is turned on on this device. Once you press the button, wait for a dialog to pop up and select your device from the list.
WARNING: device reports a disallowed feature name
WARNING: device reports neither WiFi nor telephony
optional feature not reported by device
required feature not reported, or forbidden feature reported
This is a test for near-ultrasound (18500Hz - 20000Hz) microphone response.\n This test requires two devices.\n

Open Hifi Ultrasound Microphone Test on the test device and the reference device.
 Set the media volume of the reference device at 70% and hold it with one hand.
 Hold the testing device with the other hand
 Press the RECORD button on the testing device, then the PLAY button on the reference device within one second.
 After the test, report result on the testing (recording) device.
Device does not support near-ultrasound recording.\n Please report PASS.\n
Device does not support near-ultrasound playback.\n If this is your reference device, please use a different reference device.\n
This is a test for near-ultrasound (18500Hz - 20000Hz) speaker response.\n This test requires two devices.\n

Open Hifi Ultrasound Speaker Test on the test device and the reference device.
 Set the media volume of the testing device at 70% and hold it with one hand.
 Hold the reference device with the other hand
 Press the RECORD button on the reference device, then the PLAY button on the testing device within one second.
 After the test, report result on the testing (playback) device.
Device does not support near-ultrasound recording.\n If this is your reference device, please use a different reference device.\n
Device does not support near-ultrasound playback.\n Please report PASS.\n
Please wait for the result on the reference device then report here.
Please report on the testing device.\n

This test verifies basic GPS behavior and callback scheduling. Make sure the device has line of sight to GPS satellites (for example, outside, or near a window) and then press OK to run the automated tests.

This test verifies basic GNSS behavior. Make sure the device has line of sight to GNSS satellites (for example, stationary on a windowsill. If needed, try again, outside, also with the device stationary, and with at least some view of the sky.) and then press Next to run the automated tests.

If this test fails, please make sure the device has line of sight to GNSS satellites (for example, stationary on a windowsill. If needed, try again, outside, also with the device stationary, with as much view of the sky as possible.)

This test verifies that IPv6 network connectivity continues to work when the screen is off.


1. Join a Wi-Fi network with IPv6 Internet access.
 2. If the device has battery power, disconnect all power connectors.
 3. Turn the screen off.
 4. Wait until the screen turns on (it will take at least two minutes).
 5. If necessary, unlock the device.
 6. Please mark the test according to the result status indicated.

The Peer-to-Peer Data Exchange tests require two devices with NFC enabled to exchange messages. One device must be the candidate device running the software build to be tested, while the other device must be an implementation already known to be compatible.

The Tag Verification tests check that your device can properly read and write to tags of different technologies. The MIFARE Ultralight test is only applicable for devices that support it. 

The Host-based card emulation tests check that your device has properly implemented host-based card emulation.
These tests require NFC to be enabled. Click the button below to goto Settings and enable it.
These tests require Android Beam to be enabled. Click the button below to goto NFC Sharing Settings and enable it.
Start the \"CTS Verifier NDEF Receiver\" test on another device and touch the devices back to back. The receiver should show a dialog indicating it has successfully received the correct message!
Touch this device to the back of another device running the \"CTS Verifier NDEF Receiver\"...
Start the \"CTS Verifier NDEF Sender\" test on another device and touch the devices back to back. The receiver should show a dialog indicating it has successfully received the correct message!
Touch this device to the back of another device running the \"CTS Verifier NDEF Sender\"...
Successfully received the correct NDEF push message.
Failed to receive the correct NDEF push message.

This test requires two candidate devices with NFC enabled to exchange P2P messages. Start the \"LLCP version check\" test on the other candidate device also, and touch the devices back to back. This test then verifies that the candidate device correctly advises the LLCP version as 1.2
The candidate devices does not report LLCP version 1.2 or higher.
The candidate device has a valid LLCP version.
Follow the on-screen instructions to write and read a tag of the chosen technology.
Place device on a writable %s tag...
Press OK to write to this tag...
Tap the same %s tag again to confirm that its contents match...

The host-based card emulation tests require two devices to be completed. The HCE emulator tests are used to actually test the host-based card emulation feature of the device-under-test. So the device running the emulator tests must be the candidate device running the software to be tested. \n\nFor each emulator test, there is a corresponding "reader test" in the "HCE reader tests" section. The "reader test" acts as a NFC terminal/POS and makes sure the device-under-test implements card emulation correctly.

The host-based card emulation tests require two devices to be completed. The HCE emulator tests are used to actually test the host-based card emulation feature of the device-under-test. So the device running the emulator tests must be the candidate device running the software to be tested. \n\nFor each emulator test, there is a corresponding "reader test" in the "HCE reader tests" section. The "reader test" acts as a NFC terminal/POS and makes sure the device-under-test implements card emulation correctly.

By default HCE applications must run on type A. If your device is restricted to type B (for example, because of a type B only UICC), select "Type B" from the drop-down box above. Note that all tests must be completed in the same mode (either "Type A" or "Type B").

This test verifies that the default route for ISO-DEP (ISO14443-4) frames is the host CPU. It does this by selecting an AID that any Android HCE phone will respond to if the select command is routed to the host. Please verify that there is no rule in the routing table that points this AID to the host. This test may be passed if the "PASS" button on the reader side lights up after tapping the devices together.
Select the corresponding reader test on the remote device, click OK on this dialog, and tap devices together. The pass button will be enabled if the test passes.

This test enables two non-payment services with conflicting AIDs. It then uses Androids API to allow the foreground app to set a preference for a specific service. This should prevent a popup dialog from showing. If you see a popup dialog during this asking you to select an app, this test has failed.

This test enables two payment services, and asks you to set one as the default service. It then uses Androids API to allow the foreground app to set a preference for the non-default service. This will cause the non-default payment service to be invoked.

This test requires the \"Use default\" setting to be set to \"Except when another payment app is open\". Tap OK to go to Tap and Pay settings and make sure the \"Use default\" setting is set to \"Except when another payment app is open\".

This tests enables a service that declares some AIDs to reside off-host. This test only needs to be passed if your device has a secure element (either embedded or UICC.). The responses from the secure element are not verified by the test - it is up to the tester to verify the responses are as expected.

This tests enables a service that declares some AIDs to reside off-host, and another service that runs on host. It then first sends an APDU sequence that goes off-host, and subsequently some APDUs that should go to the on-host service. This test only needs to be passed if your device has a secure element (either embedded or UICC.). The pass button will be enabled if the on-host sequence is performed as expected. The responses from the secure element are not verified by the test - it is up to the tester to verify the responses are as expected.
This test requires you to complete at least 50 HCE taps, to ensure stability of the HCE feature. The NFC service and controller should not crash or hang during any of the 50 taps.

This tests verifies that your HCE implementation can reach a decent throughput. While Android does not have any requirements on HCE performance, many HCE applications such as transport and payment apps do. If the average APDU roundtrip time is more than 50ms, please take a look at your implementation to see where the delay is coming from.
The device has an installed payment application that is currently set as default. To complete the test, you will be asked whether you want to make another app the default app. Select yes.
You will now be asked whether you want to make Payment Service #1 the default app. Select yes.

When tapping the first time, you will be shown a dialog that asks you to choose between TransportService #1 and TransportService #2. Select TransportService #2. Verify a dialog is shown that asks you to tap again to complete. Now tap again, and if communication with TransportService #2 is successfull the pass button will be enabled."
This test tries to register dynamic AIDs for a payment service.

This test tries to register a large number of different AIDs, to make sure there are no limitations on the maximum amount of HCE apps on the device. Note that this test may take a few seconds to complete; please be patient.
This test statically registers prefix AIDs for a payment service.
This test dynamically registers prefix AIDs for a non-payment service.

This test registers conflicting prefix AIDs and makes sure AID conflict detection with prefix AIDs works properly. When tapping the first time, you will be shown a dialog that asks you to choose between TransportService #1 and TransportService #2. Select TransportService #2. Verify a dialog is shown that asks you to tap again to complete. Now tap again, and if communication with TransportService #2 is successfull the pass button will be enabled."
Tests passed: %1$d, Tests skipped: %2$d, Tests failed: %3$d

Test completed with errors which indicates the device does not meet Android compatibility requirement. This will degrade user experience and cause applications to misbehave. To help debugging, please take a bug report and back up contents under /sdcard/sensorTests of the device under test.

Leave the device on top of a flat surface.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Please also turn off any special features in the device that use sensors (wake up gestures, motion triggered events, moves, etc). Not doing so is expected to cause test failures. Once you are done, you can begin the test.

The screen will be turned off to execute the tests, when tests complete, the device will vibrate and the screen will be turned back on.

This test verifies that the accelerometer is working properly. As you move the device around through space, the triangle should always point down (i.e. in the direction of gravity.) If it does not, the accelerometer is improperly configured.
Place the device on a flat surface with the screen facing the ceiling.
Place the device on a flat surface with the screen facing it.
Place the device in a flat surface resting vertically on its right side.
Place the device in a flat surface resting vertically on its left side.
Place the device in a flat surface resting vertically on its top side.
Place the device in a flat surface resting vertically on its bottom side.

This test verifies that the gyroscope is working properly.

Rotate your device as shown by the 3D block. A green background or a check mark indicates that the gyroscope's value is correct. A red background or a X mark indicates that the gyroscope's value is not right.

There are 6 parts of the test corresponding to each rotation. Press Pass for all the stages to complete this test.
It doesn\'t seem like you have a gyroscope, so you don\'t need to run this test.
These values looks like degrees per second. These should be radians per second!
Place the device in a flat surface with the screen facing the ceiling. Read the instructions for each scenario, before you perform the test.
Once you begin the test, you will need to rotate the device 360deg (one time) in the direction show by the animation, then place it back on the flat surface.

This test verifies that the heart rate monitor is working properly.

Wait for at least 1 minute before verifying.

Verify that the resting heart rate is between 0 and 100.
It doesn\'t seem like you have a heart rate monitor, so you don\'t need to run this test.
Verifying the relationship between calibrated and uncalibrated measurements...
Please calibrate the Magnetometer by moving it in 8 shapes in different orientations.
When done, leave the device in a flat surface, far from all metallic objects (if the test does not pass, try re-running it outdoors).

Put watch on your wrist and then click Next button.
Remove the watch from your wrist and then click Next button.
Click Next button, then immediate remove the watch from your wrist after the countdown reaches 0.

This test verifies that bluetooth sharing is working properly.
The test assumes the Device Under Test has bluetooth enabled and is already paired with a second device, also with bluetooth enabled.
Start this test by clicking share, choose bluetooth from the options, and then select a device to share with.
Note: This is a sample test, used to demonstrate how to write CTS Verifier tests, so just click pass.
This test verifies that tapjacking on the usb dialog is not possible by disallowing users from accepting usb debugging pemissions when dialog is obscured.

1. Connect device via usb to computer.
 2. Unroot device: adb unroot
 3. Connect over tcpip: adb tcpip 5555
 4. Click "Escalate". Settings may appear if the CTS Verifier app doesn't have display over apps permission. Enable this permission and then click back to navigate back to the app.
 5. Wait for a USB debugging dialog to appear and for the text "This message covers the USB debugging RSA prompt" to appear. There is around a 5 second delay.
 ** If no dialog appears, close the CTS Verifier app and try again. 
 6. Try clicking OK. 
 Test pass if you cannot click OK when the text quoted above is on top of the USB debugging dialog. Toast should appear saying there is an overlay so Settings cannot verify your response. 
 Note: Fake message overlay may remain on screen until you leave the test. This is working as intended.
This message covers the USB debugging RSA prompt
Please restart the application and try again.
Please enable display over apps permission for this application before proceeding.

This test verifies the orientation capabilities of camera preview and capture.
 - The left view shows a preview window rotated clockwise by a given magnitude of degrees.
 - The right view, after taking a photo, shows the captured image.
 - For each camera and orientation, both the left and right views should appear rotated clockwise by the amount of degrees specified. Choose "Pass" if this is the case. Otherwise, choose "Fail".
 - For front-facing cameras, the test will horizontally mirror the captured image prior to rotation, in attempt to make the left and right views appear the same.
 - The physical orientation of the device does not matter.
 - Read the message above the "Take Photo" button for step-by-step instructions.
Choose \"Pass\" if the left view is oriented the same as the right view. Otherwise, choose \"Fail\".
(mirrored horizontally prior to rotation, since camera is front-facing)

This test verifies that the default camera app is firing intents after pictures/videos are taken. It also verifies that when the default camera app is invoked via intents, the launch intents work, and the broadcast intents are received when appropriate per the SDK documentation.\n\n - Read the message above the \"Start Test\" button for step-by-step instructions.
Choose \"Pass\" if the right intent is fired after taking a photo from the camera app. Otherwise, choose \"Fail\".

1. Click Start Test. 
 2. Go to home screen (HOME key). 
 3. Launch Camera application. 
 4. Capture photo within 1 minute. 
 5. Return to CTS verifier app. 
 6. Pass button will light up if URI trigger was fired.
 7. Click "Pass" if possible.

1. Click Start Test. 
 2. Go to home screen (HOME key). 
 3. Launch Camera application. 
 4. Capture video within 1 minute. 
 5. Return to CTS verifier app. 
 6. Pass button will light up if URI trigger was fired.
 7. Click "Pass" if possible.

1. Click Start Test.
 2. Camera app will launch, prompting to take photo.
 3. Capture/confirm photo using camera app controls within 1 minute.
 4. Pass button will light up if URI trigger was NOT received.
 5. Click "Pass" if possible.

1. Click Start Test.
 2. Camera app will launch, prompting to take video.
 3. Capture/confirm video using camera app controls within 1 minute.
 4. Pass button will light up if URI trigger was received.
 5. Click "Pass" if possible.

This test checks that all the supported output formats for camera preview callbacks work correctly, and that the mandatory formats are available. 
 - The left view shows a standard preview window. 
 - The right view shows the output processed from camera preview callbacks. 
 - For each camera, resolution, and format combination in the dropdowns, the right view should look the same as the left, and neither should have streaks, lines, or other artifacts. 
 - For front-facing cameras, the right view must be horizontally mirrored relative to the left view.
 - Note that the frame rate of the right view may be much lower than on the left; this is not an indication of a failed test.

This test checks video capture at different resolutions. 
 - The left view window shows the preview. 
 - Pressing the test button will trigger three seconds of video recording. Playback will show up in the right view window after recording is complete. 
 - Use the spinners to choose camera and resolution combinations. The playback should be similar to what you saw in preview. 
 - After all possible combinations are tested, the pass button will be enabled. You may press the pass button to indicate a pass. 
 - You may press fail button any time during the test to indicate failure.

1. Install the Cts Verifier USB Companion app on a separate helper device. 

2. Start the accessory test companion in the Cts Verifier USB Companion. 

3. Connect the two devices. If using a OTG adapter make sure the adapter is directly connected to the helper device. If using an Type-C cable make sure that the helper device is set as "supply power to the attached device". 

4. Confirm access to the USB device on the helper device. 

5. Confirm access to the USB accessory on this device 

6. Confirm access to the USB device on the helper again. 

7. Test will run and complete automatically in less than 30 seconds. 

8. Cancel all further dialogs on this device

In this specific order: 
1. Install the Cts Verifier USB Companion app on a separate helper device. 
2. Start the accessory test companion in the Cts Verifier USB Companion. 
3. Connect the two devices. If using a OTG adapter make sure the adapter is directly connected to the helper device. If using an Type-C cable make sure that the helper device is set as "supply power to the attached device". 
4. Confirm access to the USB device on the helper device. Only confirm once. 
5. Confirm access to the USB accessory on this device. 
6. Confirm access to the USB device on the helper device again. 

Result: A progress indicator should appear or test will finish.
Test is running and will complete automatically in less than 30 seconds.

4. Confirm access to the USB device on this device. 

5. Confirm access to the USB accessory on the helper device. 

6. Confirm access to the USB device on this device again. 

7. Test will run and complete automatically in less than 30 seconds.

The CTS-verifier tests the MTP host feature with another Android device. Please connect another Android device to this Android device by using OTG cable or USB type C cable, then follow the instructions on this screen. Note the test creates/deletes files in the connected Android device.

Then press the next button.
Grant permission.\nReply a dialog asking device permission.

1. Connect your Android device to a computer with adb installed via a USB cable. 

2. Setup the CameraITS test environment by following the setup instructions in the README file found in the CameraITS directory included in the CTS Verifier bundle (cd CameraITS; source build/envsetup.sh;). 

3. Setup the test scene described in the CameraITS README file, and aim the camera at it. 

4. Run the full ITS test suite on all possible camera Ids. (cd CameraITS; python tools/run_all_tests.py). Once all of the tests have been run, the 'PASS' button will be enabled if all of the tests have succeeded. Please note that these tests can take more than 2 hours to run on some devices.

The Wi-Fi Direct tests require two devices with Wi-Fi Direct enabled to exchange messages. One device must be the candidate device running the software build to be tested, while the other device must be an implementation already known to be compatible.\n\nOne device should start the requester test, and the other should start the responder test. Your device must pass both requester and responder tests.

Go to the Security and Location settings and ensure that Location is enabled. Then go to the Wi-Fi settings and forget all remembered networks. Then start the \"GO Negotiation Requester Test\" on the other device and follow the instructions.

Go to the Security and Location settings and ensure that Location is enabled. Then go to the Wi-Fi settings and forget all remembered networks. Then start the \"Group Client Test\" on the other device and follow the instructions.
Start the \"Service Discovery Requester Test\" on the other device and follow the instructions.

Go to the Security and Location settings and ensure that Location is enabled. Then go to the Wi-Fi settings and forget all remembered networks. Then start the \"GO Negotiation Responder Test\" on the other device. Then run each test individually by clicking on its name.

Go to the Security and Location settings and ensure that Location is enabled. Then go to the Wi-Fi settings and forget all remembered networks. Then start the \"Group Owner Test\" on the other device. Then run each test individually by clicking on its name.

Go to the Security and Location settings and ensure that Location is enabled. Then go to the Wi-Fi settings and forget all remembered networks. Then start the \"Service Discovery Responder Test\" on the other device. Then run each test individually by clicking on its name.
These tests require Wi-Fi to be enabled. Click the button below to go to system settings and enable Wi-Fi.

The go negotiation responder is now ready to start. Go to the Security and Location settings and ensure that Location is enabled. Then go to the Wi-Fi settings and forget all remembered networks. Then start the \"GO Negotiation Requester Test\" on the other device. Keep the screen here until all tests on the other device are finished.

The group owner is now ready to start. Go to the Security and Location settings and ensure that Location is enabled. Then go to the Wi-Fi settings and forget all remembered networks. Then start the \"Join Group Test\" on the other device. Keep the screen here until all tests on the other device are finished.

The service responder is now ready to start. Go to the Security and Location settings and ensure that Location is enabled. Then go to the Wi-Fi settings and forget all remembered networks. Then start the \"Service Discovery Requester Test\" on the other device. Keep the screen here until all tests on the other device are finished.

This test checks that when a CA Certificate is installed, the user is notified.
Use the CertInstaller to install the certificate "MyCA.cer" from device storage. When it opens, choose any name and tap "Okay". If this button does nothing, pass the test and move on.
Visit the user-installed trusted credentials page and confirm that the "Internet Widgits Pty Ltd" cert appears in the list.
You may have been prompted to set a screen lock when installing the certificate. If so, remove it. If not, you may skip this step.

Look at the system notifications. Confirm that:
 1. There is a notification saying a certificate authority is installed.
 2. Tapping that notification brings up a more detailed explanation and a button to check trusted credentials.
 3. Tapping that button brings up the Trusted Credentials page you just visited.
Open the notification and follow the link to remove CA certificates. If removing CA certificates does not dismiss the notification, fail the test.

This test checks that credentials installed to the system can be granted, retrieved, and used to create valid HTTPS connections.
The first step sets up an internal KeyStore and generates credentials to use for the remainder of the test.\n\n Tap \'Next\' to begin.

Credentials generated. Tap 'Next' to install them to the system keychain.

 The container for the credentials will not be protected with a password; if prompted for one, leave that field blank.

 During installation you may be prompted for a name - accept the default suggestion.

 In the case that these credentials were already installed, you may skip this step.
The last test involves setting up an HTTPS connection using credentials from the KeyChain.\n\n You should be prompted to select credentials; choose the ones you just installed in the previous step.
Before marking this test as passed, tap \'Next\' to open security settings and reset the following items:\n 1. Clear device credentials.\n 2. Change the lock screen type to \'None\'.

In this test, you\'ll verify that the Settings UI for always-on VPN is correct for different VPN apps.

In this test, you'll verify the Settings UI for always-on VPN for different VPN apps. You should have received three VPN app apks with this CTS Verifier package. They're named in the form of "CtsVpnFirewallApp*.apk".

1. Before the test, make sure CtsVpnFirewallApp isn't installed on your device. You can uninstall either by UI, or by
 "adb uninstall com.android.cts.vpnfirewall"

2. Install the first test app, by running
 "adb install /path/to/CtsVpnFirewallAppApi23.apk"

3. Tap "Prepare VPN" button below and consent to the VPN connection.

4. Finish all three test cases listed below.

5. Repeat step 1 to remove CtsVpnFirewallApp.
Can\'t find VPN app. Did you install it correctly?

1. Re-install CtsVpnFirewallAppApi23.apk (skip this if you already have the correct version installed):
 "adb install -r /path/to/CtsVpnFirewallAppApi23.apk"
 2. Tap "Go" button below to go to the VPN settings page.
 3. Open configuration details page for CtsVpnFirewallApp.
 4. Confirm the "Always-on VPN" and "Block connections without VPN" switches are both off and disabled.

1. Re-install CtsVpnFirewallAppApi24.apk (skip this if you already have the correct version installed):
 "adb install -r /path/to/CtsVpnFirewallAppApi24.apk"
 2. Tap "Go" button below to go to the VPN settings page.
 3. Open configuration details page for CtsVpnFirewallApp.
 4. Confirm
 4.1. "Always-on VPN" switch is enabled and in off position
 4.2. "Block connections without VPN" switch is disabled and in off position
 4.3. "Block connections without VPN" becomes enabled once the "Always-on VPN" switch is turned on

1. Re-install CtsVpnFirewallAppNotAlwaysOn.apk (skip this if you already have the correct version installed):
 "adb install -r /path/to/CtsVpnFirewallAppNotAlwaysOn.apk"
 2. Tap "Go" button below to go to the VPN settings page.
 3. Open configuration details page for CtsVpnFirewallApp.
 4. Confirm the "Always-on VPN" and "Block connections without VPN" switches are both off and disabled.

The Alarms and Timers tests verify that the Clock app implements the AlarmClock API properly.

This test verifies that the SHOW_ALARMS API works.
 1. Press the "Show Alarms" button.
 2. Verify that a UI of the clock app is launched and displays the list of alarms

This test verifies that the ACTION_SET_ALARM with no parameters API works.
 1. Press the "Set Alarm" button.
 2. Verify that the clock app is launched and displays a UI to manage alarms.

This test verifies that the ACTION_SET_ALARM API actually starts an alarm.
 1. Press the "Start Alarm" button.
 2. Make sure the alarms UI is NOT shown
 3. Wait for the alarm to fire (may take up to 2 minutes)
 4. Verify that the alarm title is: "Start Alarm Test",
 the alarm is silent and vibrating (if the device supports vibrate).
 5. Dismiss the alarm.
 6. Verify that the alarm is not in the Clock's alarms list. The Verify button opens the alarm view.

This test verifies that the ACTION_SET_ALARM API supports all extras.

 Name of alarm: Create Alarm Test. 
 Vibrate: on. (if the device supports vibrate).
 Ringtone: silent. (if the device has a speaker).
 Time: 01:23. 
 Repeating on: Monday and Wednesday.

This tests whether a projected list view will scroll properly\n You should see 50 list items and be able to scroll up and down the list
This tests whether video playback works when projected.\n You should see a blinking white box and here a beep that is synchronized with each blink

This tests whether multitouch works.\n Touching the screen should render a dot at the location you touched.\n Touching with additional fingers will render additoinal dots and you should be able to drag them around.

This tests whether a virtual display will continue to respond to and render even when the screen is off.\n Simply follow the instructions and the test will detect the pass conditions.\n Note that turning on the screen too early will result in a failure.
Place the mobile device in a reference position. Note: to provide an accurate reference, align the device along one edge of a notebook laying on a table.
Move, shake, and rotate the device.
Place the device back to the reference position.
Angular deviation [%1$4.1f %2$4.1f %3$4.1f]. Current: %4$f deg. Max tolerated: %5$f.

This test exercises the BYOD managed provisioning flow. Start by pressing the button on screen and follow instructions to finish the managed provisioning process. If your device has not been encrypted before, it will be encrypted and rebooted. After the provisioning process completes, return to this page and carry out further verifications. Note: the device will remain encrypted after the test which can only be disabled by factory reset.

1. Press the button below to start the managed provisioning flow. If your device has not been encrypted before, it will reboot to apply encryption. After reboot follow instructions in the notification area to complete the provisioning.
 2. After successful provisioning, you should be automatically redirected back to this page. Please press through the following verification steps. Allow a few seconds after returning from provisioning, as the profile owner test should automatically pass.
 
 If the device is being encrypted during step 1, it will remain encrypted After this test. The only way to disable the encryption is to factory reset the device.
Cannot secure device with screen lock. Please re-run the test if you forgot to select the \"require PIN to boot\" option.
No PIN is detected. Please re-run the test if you forgot to set a PIN.

Next, you will be asked to set a screen lock for the device.
 
 Please set "1111" as the new PIN (or any other PIN that you can memorize). You have to enter this PIN again later in order to finish the test.
 
 You may be asked whether the PIN should be required to boot the device. Please answer yes.
 
 Tap Go button to set a new screen lock.

The test is almost finished. 
 
 Next, you will be asked to remove the screen lock that you just set. Please enter "1111" (or your own PIN) when prompted for the old PIN, and do not set any new screen lock. This is to make sure that the device returns to the initial state after this test.
 
 Tap Go button to remove existing screen lock.

This test verifies that the location updates can be enabled for the managed profile apps.

Timeout waiting for gps location change

This test verifies that the location updates can be disabled for the managed profile apps through the main location switch.
 1. Press the go button to go to the location settings page, set the main location switch disabled.
 2. Move your position a little bit, verify that no location updates toast come up and that the timeout message show up after around 15 seconds. Please wait until the timeout or location updates toast message shows up before going back to the cts-verifier tests.
 3. Go back to the cts-verifier tests using the back button, then mark the test accordingly.

This test verifies that the location updates can be disabled for the managed profile apps through work profile location switch.

 2. Move your position a little bit, verify that no location updates toast come up and that the timeout message show up after around 15 seconds. Please wait until the timeout or location updates toast message shows up before going back to the cts-verifier tests.
 3. Go back to the cts-verifier tests using the back button, then mark the test accordingly.
Primary receives updates while work location is disabled

This test verifies that location updates are still received by primary profile when location updates are disabled for managed profile apps through work profile location switch.
 1. Press the go button to go to the location settings page, set the work location switch disabled while the main location switch is still enabled.
 2. Move your position a little bit, verify that location updates toast comes up.
 Please wait until the location updates or timeout toast message shows up before going back to the cts-verifier tests.
 3. Go back to the cts-verifier tests using the back button, then mark the test accordingly.

Please press the "Request bugreport" button to invoke the bugreport sharing operation. Open the notifications panel and verify that:

 Press the "Request bugreport" button again to try to invoke a second bugreport sharing operation. Open the notifications panel and verify that:

 - Tapping on the "Taking bugreport..." notification opens a dialog titled "Share bug report?", that contains a message "Your IT admin requested a bug report to help troubleshoot this device. Apps and data may be shared, and your device may temporarily slow down." and two buttons - "DECLINE" and "SHARE".
 
 Tap the "DECLINE" button and verify that:

Please press the Go button to open Settings. Verify that:
 1) One of the Settings screens contains an entry for managed device information.
 2) Tapping that entry opens a screen.
 3) In this screen, at a minimum, you are told your organization can:
 * Change settings on this device.
 * See data associated with your work account.
 * See the list of all apps on your device.
 * See usage of each app on your device.
 * Lock the device and change the password.
 * Wipe the device.
 
 Use the Back button to return to this page.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Retrieve Traffic Logs button and record the time at which you did this.
 2) Wait one minute.
 3) Press the Open Settings button.
 4) In the screen that opens, verify that you are told traffic logs were last retrieved at the time you pressed the Retrieve Traffic Logs button in step (1).
 
 Use the Back button to return to this page.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Request Bug Report button and record the time at which you did this.
 2) Wait one minute.
 3) Press the Open Settings button.
 4) In the screen that opens, verify that you are told a bug report was last requested at the time you pressed the Request Bug Report button in step (1).
 
 Use the Back button to return to this page.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Retrieve Security Logs button and record the time at which you did this.
 2) Wait one minute.
 3) Press the Open Settings button.
 4) In the screen that opens, verify that you are told security logs were last retrieved at the time you pressed the Retrieve Security Logs button in step (1).
 
 Use the Back button to return to this page.

Please do the following:
 1) You should have received NotificationBot.apk together with the CTS verifier. If you built the CTS verifier yourself, build the NotificationBot.apk by issuing the following command on the host:
 make NotificationBot
 2) Upload the NotificationBot.apk to your device by issuing the following command on the host:
 adb push /path/to/NotificationBot.apk /sdcard
 3) Press the Uninstall button.
 4) Press the Open Settings button.
 5) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told that your administrator installed any apps.
 6) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 7) Press the Install button.
 8) Press the Open Settings button.
 9) In the screen that opens, verify that you are told now that your administrator installed at least one app.
 10) Tap on that information. Verify that a list of apps installed shows.
 11) Verify that the list contains the CTS Robot app.
 12) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 13) Press the Uninstall button.
 14) Issue the following command on the host:
 adb shell rm /sdcard/NotificationBot.apk

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Reset button.
 2) Press the Open Settings button.
 3) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told that your administrator has granted location access to any apps.
 4) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 5) Press the Grant button.
 6) Press the Open Settings button.
 7) In the screen that opens, verify that you are told now that your administrator has granted location access to at least one app.
 8) Tap on that information. Verify that a list of apps which have location access shows.
 9) Verify that the list contains the CTS Verifier app.
 10) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 11) Press the Reset button.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Reset button.
 2) Press the Open Settings button.
 3) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told that your administrator has granted microphone access to any apps.
 4) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 5) Press the Grant button.
 6) Press the Open Settings button.
 7) In the screen that opens, verify that you are told now that your administrator has granted microphone access to at least one app.
 8) Tap on that information. Verify that a list of apps that have microphone access shows.
 9) Verify that the list contains the CTS Verifier app.
 10) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 11) Press the Reset button.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Reset button.
 2) Press the Open Settings button.
 3) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told that your administrator has granted camera access to any apps.
 4) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 5) Press the Grant button.
 6) Press the Open Settings button.
 7) In the screen that opens, verify that you are told now that your administrator has granted camera access to at least one app.
 8) Tap on that information. Verify that a list of apps that have camera access shows.
 9) Verify that the list contains the CTS Verifier app.
 10) Use the Back button to return to this page.

Please do the following:
 1) When a default browser is set, you must clear it by step (2), (3) and (4).
 2) Confirm default browser by "Settings > Apps & notifications > Default apps > Browser app".
 3) Tap default browser app in the "Settings > Apps & notifications > App info".
 4) Tap "Open by default" and Tap "CLEAR DEFAULTS"
 5) Press the Reset button.
 6) Press the Open Settings button.
 7) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told that your administrator set any default apps.
 8) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 9) Press the Set Default Apps button.
 10) Press the Open Settings button.
 11) In the screen that opens, verify that you are now told that your administrator has set 7 default apps.
 12) Tap on that information. Verify that a list of default apps shows, with 7 elements in it.
 13) Verify that each element shows the CTS Verifier is the default app.
 14) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 15) Press the Reset button.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Open Settings button.
 2) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told the default keyboard has been set.
 3) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 4) Press the Set Keyboard button to set the default keyboard.
 5) Repeat steps (1) through (3), verifying that in step (2), you are told now that the default keyboard has been set to CTS Verifier.
 6) Press the Finish button to clear the default keyboard.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Open Settings button.
 2) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told that an always-on VPN is set.
 3) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 4) Press the Set VPN button to set an always-on VPN.
 5) Repeat steps (1) through (3), verifying that in step (2), you are told now that an always-on VPN is set.
 6) Press the Finish button to clear the always-on VPN.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Start button to create a work profile.
 2) Press the Open Settings button.
 3) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told that an always-on VPN is set.
 4) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 5) Press the Set VPN button to set an always-on VPN in your work profile.
 6) Repeat steps (2) through (4), verifying that in step (3), you are told now that an always-on VPN is set in your work profile.
 7) Press the Finish button to remove the work profile and always-on VPN.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Open Settings button.
 2) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told that a global HTTP proxy has been set.
 3) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 4) Press the Set Proxy button.
 5) Repeat steps (1) through (3), verifying that in step (2), you are told now that a global HTTP proxy has been set.
 6) Press the Clear Proxy button.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Open Settings button.
 2) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told that your administrator installed trusted CA certs.
 3) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 4) Press the Install Cert button to install a trusted CA cert.
 5) Repeat steps (1) through (3), verifying that in step (2), you are told now that the administrator has installed at least one trusted CA cert.
 6) Press the Finish button to clear the cert.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Start button to create a work profile.
 2) Press the Settings button.
 3) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told that your administrator installed trusted CA certs.
 4) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 5) Press the Install Cert button to install a trusted CA cert in your work profile.
 6) Repeat steps (2) through (4), verifying that in step (3), you are told now that the administrator has installed at least one trusted CA cert in your work profile.
 7) Press the Finish button to remove the work profile and cert.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Open Settings button.
 2) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told all device data will be deleted if you mistype your password too many times.
 3) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 4) Press the Set Limit button to set the maximum number of password attempts.
 5) Repeat steps (1) through (3), verifying that in step (2), you are told now that all device data will be deleted if you mistype your password 100 times.
 6) Press the Finish button to clear the maximum number of password attempts.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Start button to create a work profile.
 2) Press the Open Settings button.
 3) In the screen that opens, verify that you are not told work profile data will be deleted if you mistype your password too many times.
 4) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 5) Press the Set Limit button to set the maximum number of password attempts.
 6) Repeat steps (2) through (4), verifying that in step (3), you are told now that work profile data will be deleted if you mistype your password 100 times.
 7) Press the Finish button to remove the work profile.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Clear Org button.
 2) Open and fully expand Quick Settings.
 3) Verify that at the bottom of Quick Settings, you are told the device is managed.
 4) Close Quick Settings.
 5) Press the Set Org button.
 6) Open and fully expand Quick Settings.
 7) Verify that at the bottom of Quick Settings, you are told the device is managed by "Foo, Inc.".
 8) Tap on the information.
 9) Verify that a dialog informing you about device monitoring opens.
 10) Tap the "Learn more" link.
 11) Verify that a screen informing you what your managing organization can do is shown.
 
 Use the Back button to return to this page.

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Open Settings button to open Settings.
 2) Navigate to "Security" > "Screen lock" and select the first screen lock type that is not "None".
 3) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 4) Press the Clear Org button.
 5) Lock the device.
 6) Verify that on the lock screen, you are told the device is managed.
 7) Unlock the device.

 9) Lock the device.
 10) Verify that on the lock screen, you are told the device is managed by "Foo, Inc.".
 11) Unlock the device.
 12) Repeat steps (1) through (11) for each screen lock type other than "None".

Please do the following:
 1) Press the Clear Org button.
 2) Press the Open Settings button.
 3) In the screen that opens, verify that you are told that the device is managed.
 4) Use the Back button to return to this page.
 5) Press the Set Org button.
 6) Press the Open Settings button.
 7) In the screen that opens, verify that you are told that the device is managed by "Foo, Inc.".
 8) Tap the "Learn more" link.
 9) Verify that a screen informing you what your managing organization can do is shown.
 11) Use the Back button to return to this page.

Please do the following:
 1) Open and fully expand Quick Settings.
 2) Check that you are told that your device is managed.
 3) Close Quick Settings.
 4) Enable network logging by tapping on the left button below.
 5) Open Quick Settings again. Check that an icon appeared next to the text about device management.
 6) Verify that a notification including the same icon popped up, informing you that network logging has been enabled.
 7) Tap the notification.
 8) Verify that a dialog about device monitoring opens, and informs you about: the name of the app that manages this device, details about the device owner's capabilities, and information that the admin has activated network logging and can see all network traffic.
 9) Close the dialog.
 10) Tap the right button below to disable network logging.
 11) Verify that the notification disappeared.
Press the OK button to start the managed provisioning flow, and complete the flow to create a work profile
This test is mostly automated, but requires some user interaction. You can pass this test once the list items below are checked.
Verify the behavior of the JobScheduler API for when the device is in idle mode. Simply follow the on-screen instructions.
Turn the screen off and then back on in order to begin.
Switch off screen and wait for it to turn on to continue.
Idle job does not execute when device is not idle.
Idle job does execute when device is forced into idle.
Verify the behavior of the JobScheduler API for when the device is on power and unplugged from power. Simply follow the on-screen instructions.
Plug in the charger if it isn\'t already plugged in.
Device not charging will not execute a job with a charging constraint.
Device when charging will execute a job with a charging constraint.
After the above test has passed, remove the charger to continue. If the above failed, you can simply fail this test.
Device is plugged in. Please wait while it gets into stable charging state.
There seems to be a problem with your charger. Please try again.
Verify the behavior of the JobScheduler API for when the device has no access to data connectivity. Simply follow the on-screen instructions.
Disable WiFi and Mobile data to begin.
Device with no connectivity will not execute a job with an unmetered connectivity constraint.
Device with no connectivity will not execute a job with an unmetered connectivity constraint.
Device with no connectivity will still execute a job with no connectivity constraints.
Verify that the bundled TV app launches via Intent and calls the proper API to discover 3rd-party TV inputs.
Does the bundled TV app support third-party TV inputs?
Select the \"Launch TV app\" button and set up the newly installed TV input: \"CTS Verifier\".
Setup activity must have been started.
Select the \"Launch TV app\" button and tune to the \"Dummy\" channel from \"CTS Verifier\" input. If necessary, configure the channel to be visible.
Verify that the overlay appears and displays the text \"Overlay View Dummy Text\" when you tune to the \"Dummy\" channel.
Verify that video layout changes correctly according to the provided video track information, including pixel aspect ratio.
Verify the TV app provides query results for 3rd-party input\'s channels and programs in global search results.
Select the \"Launch EPG\" button and locate the \"Dummy\" channel.
Do you see the programs named \"Dummy Program\" and their descriptions "Dummy Program Description" in the EPG?
Select the \"Launch setup\" button and verify if the bundled TV app shows the list of installed TV inputs for setup.
Do you see the \"CTS Verifier\" input in the list?
Verify that the bundled TV app calls the parental controls API.
Select the \"Launch TV app\" button and turn on the parental controls. If parental controls are on already, turn it off and on again.
TV input service must have received ACTION_PARENTAL_CONTROLS_ENABLED_CHANGED broadcast.
Is there an option to turn off parental controls on this device?

Select the \"Launch TV app\" button and block the \"Custom Rating\" for \"CtsVerifier\" rating system in the parental control settings. If the rating system is disabled by default, enable it. If the \"Custom Rating\" is already blocked, unblock it, save, and then block again.
TV input service must have received ACTION_BLOCKED_RATINGS_CHANGED broadcast.
Select the \"Launch TV app\" button; verify that the channel is blocked. Try to unblock the screen by entering PIN; verify that it\'s unblocked.
CtsVerifier channel is not set up. Please set up before proceeding.
TV app closed captions and multi-audio test
Verify that the bundled TV app calls the multi-track API.
Select the \"Launch TV app\" button. Verify that closed captions are off by default. Set closed caption language to English.
The English closed caption track should be selected.
Select the \"Launch TV app\" button. Verify that the audio track is English by default. Select Spanish audio track.
The Spanish audio track should be selected.
This test verifies that the TV app invokes proper time shift APIs in the framwork.
Press the \"Launch TV app\" button. Verify that the playback control is available. Pause the playback and then resume it.
The playback should resume after pause.
The playback position tracking should be activated.
Press the \"Launch TV app\" button. Verify that the playback control is available. Rewind the playback and in a few seconds fast-forward it.
Press the \"Launch TV app\" button. Verify that the playback control is available. Seek to previous and then seek to next.
The playback position should be moved to the previous position.
The playback position should be moved to the next position.
Verify that the bundled TV app supports linking to channel apps. If a TV input service provides links for its specific channels, the TV app should show the links in a proper format.
Select the \"Launch TV app\" button, then check if you can see a menu with \"Cts App-Link Text\" text in red background. If you see the link, select it to follow the link.
The app-link must have been clicked and the activity should be changed correctly.

Do you see the app-link card similar to the image on the left?
 1) You should see the poster art image, but the color may be different.
 2) You should see the text "Cts App-Link Text".
Example of input app specific custom rating.
Pressing next will prompt you to enter screen pinning, allow this app to enter screen pinning.
Press Next to verify the app is pinned.
Try to leave the app without unpinning the screen. Press next once you have verified you cannot leave.
Use interactions defined by your device to unpin such as long pressing the back and overview button, then press next.
The screen was no longer pinned.
Cannot start the test with the screen already pinned.
Could not exit screen pinning through API.
Click the "Clear Messages" button then connect and disconnect a wired headset. Note if the appropriate notification messages appear below.
Click the "Clear Messages" button then connect and disconnect a microphone or wired headset. Note if the appropriate notification messages appear below.

Click on the "Record" button in the AudioRecord Routing Notifications section below to start recording. Insert a wired headset or microphone. Observe a message acknowledging the rerouting event below. Remove the wired headset and observe the new routing message. Click on the "Stop" button to stop recording.\n

Click on the "Play" button in the AudioTrack Routing Notifications section below to start (silent) playback. Insert a wired headset. Observe a message acknowledging the rerouting event below. Remove the wired headset and observe the new routing message. Click on the "Stop" button to stop playback.\n
Connect the USB Audio Interface Peripheral and press the PLAY button below. Verify that a tone is correctly played.
Connect the USB Audio Peripheral and press the RECORD or RECORD LOOPBACK button below. Verify that a tone is correctly played.
Connect the USB Audio headset with buttons and press each transport/media button in turn.
Does this device have a headset port?
WARNING: Some results show potential deficiencies on the system. Please consider addressing them for a future release.
Audio Level is not maximum. Please check your device is set to max level for audio playback.

This test requires the Loopback Plug. Please connect a Loopback Plug into the headset connector, and proceed with the instructions on the screen. The system will measure the input-output audio latency by injecting a pulse on the output, and computing the distance between replicas of the pulse. You can vary the Audio Level slider to ensure the pulse will feed back at adequate levels. Repeat until a confidence level >= 0.6 is achieved.
Please connect a "Loopback Plug" and press "Loopback Plug Ready".
Set the audio level to a suitable value, then press Test button. It might require multiple tries until a confidence >= 0.6 is achieved.

The system will measure the frequency response of the left and right line outputs, by feeding them back thru the microphone conection with the loopback jack. This test requires the Loopback Plug. Please connect a Loopback Plug on the headset connector, and proceed with the instructions on the screen.
Please connect a "Loopback Plug" and press "Loopback Plug Ready".

This test requires an external USB reference microphone. Please connect the USB microphone and proceed with the instructions on the screen. The system will measure frequency response of the left and right speakers (if there are two speakers), or the response of the mono speaker twice.
Please connect an USB reference microphone and press "USB Reference microphone ready"
USB Audio device detected\n\nPlease set up Device Under test in quiet room, and Microphone 20 cms perpendicular to center of screen, then press TEST
"No USB Audio device detected. Please reconnect."

This test requires an external USB reference microphone and external speakers. The test signals can be played from the device under test (DUT) or from a secondary device (e.g. when your DUT cant support a USB microphone and external speakers simultaneously, or DUT does not have headphone output). Follow the instructions on the screen to measure the frequency response for the built in microphone.
TEST NOISE: Position speakers 40 cms from device under test. Press [PLAY] to play broadband white noise. Press [TEST]
TEST USB BACKGROUND: Connect USB microphone and position it right next to microphone under test. No source of noise should be active during this test. Press [TEST]
TEST USB NOISE: Connect USB microphone and position it right next to microphone under test. Position speakers 40 cms from device under test. Press [PLAY] to play broadband white noise. Press [TEST]

This test requires an external USB reference microphone, external speakers and a Sound Pressure Level meter. You can play the test signals from the device under test or from a secondary device. Follow the instructions on the screen to measure the frequency response for the built in microphone using UNPROCESSED audio source. If the Audio Frequency Unprocessed feature is defined in this system, success in all tests is mandatory to pass. If the feature is not defined, measurements are still needed, but success in all of them is not mandatory to pass.
Audio Frequency Unprocessed feature is defined. Success in all tests is mandatory to pass
Audio Frequency Unprocessed feature is NOT defined. Success in all test is NOT mandatory to pass
TEST TONE: Press [PLAY] to play tone at 1 Khz. Measure sound SPL to be 94 dB right next to microphone under test. Press [TEST]
TEST NOISE: Position speakers 40 cms from device under test. Press [PLAY] to play broadband white noise. Press [TEST]
TEST USB BACKGROUND: Connect USB microphone and position it right next to microphone under test. No source of noise should be active during this test. Press [TEST]
TEST USB NOISE: Connect USB microphone and position it right next to microphone under test. Position speakers 40 cms from device under test. Press [PLAY] to play broadband white noise. Press [TEST]
Mark where you are standing with something like a piece of card and then press ready to record this waypoint

When you are ready to place your first waypoint, place a marker at the devices current location. Use something that will allow you to put the device in the exact same position and orientation on the second lap. Then, while the device is on the marker, click the turquoise action button to record the first waypoint.\n\nStart walking in a direction. The button will appear again when you have walked far enough. Place a marker at the device\'s location and press the button to record a waypoint. You cannot place waypoints in a straight line, so for your 3rd waypoint turn 90 degrees and walk in a direction that will make a triangle out of your 3 waypoints.

You now need to visit each waypoint, clicking the turquoise action button at each one. You need to reach each waypoint in 20 seconds. While you are on your way to the waypoints, the camera preview will rotate. You will need to rotate the device to match the rotation of the camera preview. A box will be shown to help you. It shows the device\'s current rotation and will change color based on whether you are close enough to the required rotation. Red if you are failing, green if you are passing. When you have reached the next waypoint, the device can be returned to its original rotation.
Go back to the first waypoint
Now go back to the first waypoint and press ready to finish the first lap.
Now, go to each waypoint (including your initial one) and click the turquoise action button. Then move on to the next waypoint and do the same.\nThe last waypoint should be the first waypoint again.
These tests are designed to verify the correctness and accuracy of a 6DoF enabled device. There will be 3 phases to these tests, each testing a different part of 6DoF functionality.

This first test will test the accuracy of the device. It will ask you to mark out 4 waypoints and then return to the original waypoint to complete the lap. After this you will then need to do another lap without any HUD information. At the end, the pairs of waypoints and the path you travelled will be compared and you will be given a result.

This test will test the robustness of the device. Using the same 4 waypoints as before, you will need to do a lap, reaching each waypoint in the allotted time.\nWhile you are on your way to the waypoints, the camera preview will rotate. You will need to rotate the device to match the rotation of the camera preview. A box will be shown to help you. It shows the device\'s current rotation and will change color based on whether you are close enough to the required rotation. Red if you are failing, green if you are passing. When you have reached the next waypoint, the device can be returned to its original rotation.

Now we will test the AR capability of the device. Again, you will need to do a lap of the waypoints, but this time between each waypoint the device will overlay hoops that you must pass the device through as you go along.
Not far away enough from other waypoints!
Not close enough to initial waypoint!
Motion Tracking has entered an invalid state
UI fragment was null, couldn\'t do callback to listener
%1$s seconds remaining to get to next waypoint
Test Failed because Test Activity was paused
Go through the rings as you visit waypoints.
You haven\'t collected all the rings in this path!
